The revenue for the first quarter of 2022 reached KRW 77.8 trillion, marking a new all-time quarterly high for the third consecutive quarter. This increase was primarily driven by strong performances in the Memory and Visual Display businesses, with the DX division achieving its highest revenue since 2013. The growth was attributed to premium-focused strategies and meeting strong server memory demand. On a year-on-year basis, revenue grew by 19%, with at least 10% growth across all business units except for large panels, where LCD production was being ramped down.

Gross profit for the quarter was KRW 30.7 trillion, a decrease of KRW 0.9 trillion sequentially, mainly due to increased material and logistics costs influenced by macroeconomic issues. The gross margin declined slightly by 1.8 percentage points to 39.5%. SG&A expenses were reduced by KRW 1.2 trillion quarter-on-quarter to KRW 16.6 trillion, which helped maintain solid profitability.

In terms of market conditions, the company faced challenges such as a contraction in TV market demand both year-on-year and quarter-on-quarter, influenced by the base effect of last year's pent-up demand, weak seasonality, and geopolitical issues. Despite these challenges, the company expanded revenue by targeting high-value premium products and enhancing cost efficiency in sales activities.

The company had previously guided for sales growth in 2022, and the Q1 results aligned with this guidance due to the successful implementation of premium product strategies and improved product mix, particularly in the S22 Series. The increase of Ultra models within the S22 Series improved the average selling prices (ASPs) and contributed to the flagship revenue growth quarter-over-quarter.

Looking forward, the company expects ongoing uncertainties, including supply chain disruptions related to COVID-19 and international political instability. However, it plans to mitigate these challenges by strengthening cooperation with partners and utilizing long-term contracts. The company aims to continue its focus on premium products and operational efficiency to achieve sustained growth and profitability in the coming quarters.
